commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: We're back.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hey Shizuku, Kasumi, Rina. How did you go gathering signatures?

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Not so good.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: I asked a bunch of people, but no one really seemed that into it.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Same for you, huh?

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: We didn't get many signatures either. I thought it was gonna be a piece of cake, but I guess that was a bit naive of me.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I still do not think it is a bad idea to gather signatures to hold the School Idol Festival at Nijigasaki and get everybody excited from within the school.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Yeah. The girls who know about the School Idol Festival are really cooperative.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: You're right about that. I feel like there's a huge difference in attitude between the girls who know and the ones who don't.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Oh, that explains it...

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Yeah, I talked to many different students to gather their signatures, but I realized that there are lots of girls who don't actually know about us or the School Idol Festival.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: What, really?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Nijigasaki High School has a lot of students, so there are many who do not know about us.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: What a huge miscalculation. Rina-chan Board says, "Disappointed."

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Aww, but everyone in my class supports us and gave me their signatures!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I suppose we've never really thought about how well-known we are around the school...

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I was happy because it seemed like we gained renown after seeing the response online and from the girls who came to the school tour, but I guess we still have a ways to go.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: I see. It makes sense that they don't really care about some club they don't know much about gathering signatures for an event they want to hold.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: We've been focused on spreading the word outside, but we actually needed to have a strong base within the school first.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: I didn't think we were that unknown within our own school.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: I guess we were stuck in our own little bubble. Rina-chan Board says, "Sad-face."

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Yeah, we need to reflect on that.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: But I'm glad we realized something as important as that. Let's spread the word about the School Idol Festival within our school first!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: The question is how we'll do that. How about a bunch of guerrilla gigs at the same time all around the school?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Ooh, that sounds like fun! I'll charm everyone into becoming my fans and then grab their signatures!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: No, doing so may anger Shioriko. We must obtain permission for everything! However, I do think it is vital that we are seen by everyone.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Even if we offer everyone a chance to see us, no one's gonna stop to watch unless they're actually interested, right?

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: We need to make ourselves appealing even to those who are not interested, you say?

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: It's pretty tough to grab the attention of someone who's not interested.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: If only there was a way to subliminally tap into everyone's eyes and ears.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Is there a way to do that? Should we put up posters on the school's notice boards?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Nah, people don't look at posters unless they want to. I wish we could grab their attention without being imPOSTERs. Get it? *Laugh*

commands.speaker: School Broadcast
commands.line: The school will be closing soon. Students who are still present due to club activities, please proceed to tidy up and return home. I repeat...

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Oh, it's already time to go home? We gotta pack up.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hey...

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: What's up?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: That's it! The PA system! Students are allowed to air a broadcast during lunch at school, right? Maybe we could ask the broadcasting club if we could use it during lunch.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: I see. People would naturally listen to us that way.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: And I believe everybody will remember us without any effort if we repeat the same thing every day!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Yeah! That's it, Shizuko!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: The Nijigasaki High Lunchtime Broadcast with the School Idol Club! That might be something worth giving a try.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Yeah! Let's give it a shot!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Okay, I'll try talking to the broadcasting club tomorrow!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Hello!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Um, Mari? Hi, are you free right now? There's something I want to discuss with you regarding the preparations for the School Idol Festival.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Of course! I could talk with you over the phone until the sun comes up tomorrow!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: No, you can't! You gotta sleep! Wait, I mean... No! That's not what I meant!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Wow, so that's how it turned out?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yup. I somehow managed to come to an agreement with the broadcasting club, so we'll be on air starting tomorrow at lunch.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Excellent! It sounds like fun! Hehehe, I've got something I want to say to all of Nijigasaki myself, so I'll join in as a special guest tomorrow!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: What? Um, I'm totally open to having guests drop by, but there's no way you can find the time during lunch on a weekday, can you?

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: No problem! I've got my own secret plan!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: A secret plan?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: We should head over to the broadcasting room soon.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yup, let's go.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: What's that?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hm?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Is it just me, or is that helicopter headed straight for us?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Huh? Whoa, it's really close! It's gonna crash into us!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Whoopsie, I got in trouble!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Yeah, you did! No regular person drops in all the way from Numazu by helicopter!

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Yeah, I was really surprised when I saw you pop out of the helicopter.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: The whole school was shocked. That's so like you to make a grand entrance, Mari.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: You totally managed to grab everyone's attention, though!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: I got flooded with questions about you and the School Idol Festival when I returned to my classroom after the broadcast!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: There were a lot of students getting awfully giddy about the appearance of an Aqours member.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: You got yelled at, but I'm glad you came.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: While it was a little different from what I had imagined, we managed to complete our objective!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: *Laugh* And we really have Mari's "secret plan" to thank for that.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Hehehe, it was worth the trip if I could be such a big help. Mission accomplished!
